channel.title: 3rd age problem
channel.description:
Ok i got a server...Source:Czar
I'm owner for sure...But when i pickup a 3rd age thing ex:41511 (random number) just to show there is 5 number so when i do
::pickup 41511 10
it says:Wrong syntax use it as ::pickup 0995 10
So can some1 tell how i can fix that ?
thanks

item.title: 3rd age problem
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

Ew ew ew ew ewwwwwwwwww …

Niall shouldn’t have deleted my string splitting tutorial …

Nevermind look at this. Much better way to fix your problem.

You’ll be able to do ::pickup 995 100000 as well as
::pickup 123425345355345 5345365467547578 it isn’t confined to length so you don’t need 0’s in front of your numbers either.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd age problem
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax, use as ::pickup 00995 10, dumbass. "); }
Got that from tico’s silab client tut, with a lil edidting.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd age problem
item.dc:creator: @lynx_16 lynx_16
item.description:
@lynx_16 wrote:

well here the command but i can found the 4 digit you say…:

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Mod Steve") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd age problem
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

You have to mess with your pickup commands so it reads ids as 5 digits not 4. Look around the command youll find it.

Read full topic
